gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a memory controller block (MCB). It handles initialization, dynamic calibration, and termination calibration for DDR memory interfaces. The module adjusts timing parameters and termination impedances to optimize memory performance and signal integrity. It includes state machines for various calibration steps, such as RZQ (reference impedance) calibration, ZIO (zero impedance) calibration, and DQS (data strobe) delay adjustments. The calibration process involves reading and writing to IODRP (I/O Device, Register, Port) controllers and interacting with the memory controller to fine-tune settings based on measured values and predefined thresholds.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START

Explanation:
UI_CLK: User interface clock input
RST: Reset input
PLL_LOCK: PLL lock signal input
SELFREFRESH_REQ: Self-refresh request input
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: Self-refresh MCB mode input
RZQ_IN: Reference impedance input
RZQ_IODRP_SDO: RZQ IODRP serial data output
ZIO_IN: Zero impedance input
ZIO_IODRP_SDO: ZIO IODRP serial data output
MCB_UOSDO: MCB user output serial data output
MCB_UODONECAL: MCB user output done calibration signal
MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB user output refresh flag
MCB_UODATA: MCB user output data
MCB_UODATAVALID: MCB user output data valid signal
MCB_UOCMDREADY: MCB user output command ready signal
MCB_UO_CAL_START: MCB user output calibration start signal

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train

Explanation:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Soft and hard calibration done signal
SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ: Self-refresh MCB request output
SELFREFRESH_MODE: Self-refresh mode output
IODRP_ADD: IODRP address output
IODRP_SDI: IODRP serial data input
RZQ_IODRP_CS: RZQ IODRP chip select
ZIO_IODRP_CS: ZIO IODRP chip select
MCB_UIADD: MCB user input address
MCB_UISDI: MCB user input serial data input
MCB_UICS: MCB user input chip select
MCB_UIDRPUPDATE: MCB user input DRP update
MCB_UIBROADCAST: MCB user input broadcast
MCB_UIADDR: MCB user input address
MCB_UICMDEN: MCB user input command enable
MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB user input done calibration
MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC: MCB user input DQ lower decrement
MCB_UIDQLOWERINC: MCB user input DQ lower increment
MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC: MCB user input DQ upper decrement
MCB_UIDQUPPERINC: MCB user input DQ upper increment
MCB_UILDQSDEC: MCB user input LDQS decrement
MCB_UILDQSINC: MCB user input LDQS increment
MCB_UIREAD: MCB user input read
MCB_UIUDQSDEC: MCB user input UDQS decrement
MCB_UIUDQSINC: MCB user input UDQS increment
MCB_RECAL: MCB recalibration signal
MCB_UICMD: MCB user input command
MCB_UICMDIN: MCB user input command input
MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB user input DQ count
MCB_SYSRST: MCB system reset
Max_Value: Maximum value output
CKE_Train: CKE training output

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:

STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, RstCounter, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done, PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3, WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH, START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1, Rst_condition1, WAIT_200us_COUNTER, WaitTimer, WarmEnough, pre_sysrst_cnt.

Explanation:

STATE: Represents the current state of the calibration state machine.
P_Term, N_Term: Store the P-termination and N-termination values.
P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Temporary storage for skewed termination values.
P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous P-termination and N-termination values.
IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR: Address for IODRP controller memory cell.
IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Data to be written to IODRP controller.
Active_IODRP: Indicates which IODRP is currently active.
IODRPCTRLR_R_WB: Read/Write control for IODRP controller.
IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID: Command valid signal for IODRP controller.
IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST: IODRP controller use broadcast signal.
MCB_CMD_VALID: Command valid signal for MCB.
MCB_USE_BKST: MCB use broadcast signal.
Pre_SYSRST: Internal system reset signal.
IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output.
Max_Value_Previous: Stores the previous maximum value.
count: Generic counter used in various states.
counter_en: Counter enable signal.
First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Flag indicating first dynamic calibration is complete.
DQS_DELAY_INITIAL: Initial DQS delay value.
DQS_DELAY: Current DQS delay value.
TARGET_DQS_DELAY: Target DQS delay value.
counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for increment and decrement operations.
RST_reg: Registered reset signal.
Block_Reset: Signal to block reset during certain operations.
MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered MCB user output data valid signal.
RstCounter: Counter for reset delay.
LastPass_DynCal: Indicates the last pass of dynamic calibration.
First_In_Term_Done: Flag indicating first input termination is complete.
PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2: Registered PLL lock signals.
SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3: Registered self-refresh request signals.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3: Registered self-refresh MCB mode signals.
WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL: Flag to wait for self-refresh exit DQS calibration.
PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH: Flag to perform dynamic calibration after self-refresh.
START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1: Registered start dynamic calibration state.
PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1: Registered flag to perform dynamic calibration after self-refresh.
Rst_condition1: Reset condition signal.
WAIT_200us_COUNTER: Counter for 200us wait period.
WaitTimer: Timer for wait operations.
WarmEnough: Flag indicating system is warm enough.
pre_sysrst_cnt: Counter for pre-system reset.
